configuration.debug.logToConsole.descrip: Enables this extension to log information to a VSCode output channel.
configuration.debug.logToFile.descriptio: Enables this extension to log information to a file inside the project's folder.
configuration.extension.quickStart.descr:
Enables quick start mode.

When quick start mode is enabled, the extension will open the current folder automatically if it is a valid RPG Maker project.
configuration.extension.autoReveal.descr: Allows the extension to reveal the active script file on the extension's script editor view.
configuration.extension.filesEndOfLine.e: Auto mode uses the appropiate EOL type based on the operating system
configuration.extension.filesEndOfLine.d: Choose the type of end of line that the extension will use for files.
configuration.extension.insertEncodingCo:
Allows the extension to insert a magic comment (# encoding: utf-8) inside every Ruby script file.

In older versions of the extension, all scripts must have this magic comment because Ruby was not able to determine the encoding of a file.

This is not needed anymore since v1.5.0 but it is available at the user's choice.

You can read more in the extension's README.
configuration.extension.recreateScriptLo:
Whether to re-create the script loader when a project is opened or not.

The script loader this extension uses is subject to change between updates so it is recommended to leave it enabled.

Only disable this if you are using a custom script loader or you want to update the script loader manually between updates.
configuration.extension.scriptNameValida: Auto mode enables/disables script name validation when necessary

Choose script name validation mode.

Due to a Ruby limitation, any RPG Maker that uses a version of Ruby below v1.9 must enable this setting.

The RPG Maker versions affected by this limitation are: RPG Maker XP and RPG Maker VX.

If you are using MKXP-Z you don't need to use this, regardless of the RPG Maker version.

Check extension's README for more information.

**DISABLE AT YOUR OWN RISK**
configuration.external.backUpsFolder.des: The relative path within the project's folder where all bundle scripts files backups will be saved.
configuration.external.loadOrderBackUpsF: The relative path within the project's folder where all bundle scripts files backups will be saved.
configuration.external.scriptsFolder.des: The relative path within the project's folder where all scripts will be extracted.
configuration.external.extensionLogFileF: The relative path within the project's folder where the extension log file is created.
configuration.external.gameLogFileFolder: The relative path within the project's folder where the game log file is created.
configuration.external.scriptsCompileFol: The relative path within the project's folder where the compiled scripts bundle file is saved.
configuration.gameplay.gameExecutablePat: The relative path to the game executable inside the project folder.
configuration.gameplay.useWine.descripti: Sets the command to invoke Wine to run the game executable. (Linux Only!)
configuration.gameplay.runGameBehavior.e: This is the default RPG Maker behavior (You need to close the game before running it again
Kills the game executable and runs it again automatically
Allows multiple game processes running at the same time
configuration.gameplay.runGameBehavior.d: Choose how the game executable is handled when it is already running.
configuration.gameplay.automaticArgument:
Enables automatic arguments detection mode.

If enabled, the extension will automatically choose the appropiate arguments based on the RPG Maker version detected.
configuration.gameplay.nativeConsole.des: Enables RPG Maker native console. (RPG Maker VX Ace only!)
configuration.gameplay.customArguments.d:
Set your own custom arguments here separated by a whitespace.

You must disable 'auto. arguments detection' behavior to use this!
configuration.gameplay.gameExceptionAuto: Allows the extension to auto-process the last detected exception.
configuration.gameplay.gameExceptionShow: Allows the extension to show a markdown file besides the active editor with the exception backtrace information.
viewsWelcome.contents1:
There is no folder open in Visual Studio Code.
You should open a RPG Maker project folder to start this extension.
[Open Folder](command:vscode.openFolder)
viewsWelcome.contents2:
A folder is currently open.
You can select the folder to set it as the active RPG Maker folder using the button below.
[Set Active Project Folder](command:rgss-script-editor.setProjectFolder)
viewsWelcome.contents3:
There is more than one folder open in Visual Studio Code.
You can select a folder to set it as the active RPG Maker folder using the button below.
[Set Active Project Folder](command:rgss-script-editor.setProjectFolder)
viewsWelcome.contents4:
To use this extension you must extract the contents of the RPG Maker bundled file.
A new folder with all script files extracted will be created inside the folder.
Once all scripts are extracted, you can start using this editor
[Extract Scripts](command:rgss-script-editor.extractScripts)
